fseq.reporting package¶

Submodules¶

fseq.reporting.report_builder module¶

The report builders are classes that coordinate report productions

class fseq.reporting.report_builder.ReportBuilderBase(*reports, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for common report builder features.

Most prominently, the distill-method needs to be implemented in subclasses to make much sence in most use cases.

outputRoot outputNamePrefix

DEFAULT_REPORTS = ()¶
addReports(*reports)[source]¶

Adds any number of reports given that the reports exposes a distill method.

*reports: objects, optional

fseq.ReportBuilderBase
Returns self
ValueError
If a report lacks a method named distill or can’t be hashed
distill(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The base distiller will not process any data passed to it, it will send all arguments and keyword arguments to the individual reports.

If either outputRoot or outputNamePrefix are passed as kwargs, the corresponding values preset in the system will be added to the kwargs sent to the subreports.

fseq.ReportBuilderBase
Returns self
outputNamePrefix[source]¶

Partial file name to prepend the individual reports: str

outputRoot[source]¶

The base for saving out reports: str

class fseq.reporting.report_builder.ReportBuilderFFT(*reports, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: fseq.reporting.report_builder.ReportBuilderBase

Samples part of data set and performs FFT-based analysis on it.

distanceMetric sampleSize

ReportBuilderBase
Base class implementing more attributes.
DEFAULT_REPORTS = (<class 'fseq.reporting.reports.HeatMap'>,)¶
METRICS = set(['kulsinski', 'chebyshev', 'yule', 'sokalmichener', 'dice', 'canberra', 'jaccard', 'minkowski', 'seuclidean', 'mahalanobis', 'sqeuclidean', 'euclidean', 'russellrao', 'cosine', 'sokalsneath', 'braycurtis', 'hamming', 'correlation', 'cityblock', 'rogerstanimoto', 'matching'])¶
distanceMetric[source]¶
distill(data, distanceMetric=None, clusterOnAbsOnly=True, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Make reports from data.

Produces two analyses:

Amplitude evaluation
A clustered FFT-amplitude analysis
Angle evaluation
A clustered FFT-angle analysis
data: numpy.ndarray
The 2D-array of data given
distanceMetric: str, optional
A distance metric to overwrite the default one of the instance.
clusterOnAbsOnly: bool, optional
If clustering should be performed only on the amplitude (abs-values) or if amplitude and angle be clustered independently. (Default: Cluster only on amplitude)
sampleSize[source]¶
class fseq.reporting.report_builder.ReportBuilderPositionAverage(*reports, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: fseq.reporting.report_builder.ReportBuilderBase

Per position analysis builder.

undecidedValue

ReportBuilderBase
Base class which implements some more attributes.
DEFAULT_REPORTS = (<class 'fseq.reporting.reports.LinePlot'>,)¶
distill(data, undecidedValue=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The distiller will create reports for several position-type informations.

Average Lacking Data Frequency
The number of undecided values.
Average Non-Lacking Data
The per position average for all non-lacking data values.
Average Combined Data
The per position average as encoded.
data: numpy.ndarray
An array of numerically encoded sequence information
undecidedValue: float, optional
The value that undecided sequence positions are encoded as. If not supplied, the previously set value of the class instance will be used. (Default: 0.5)
*args:
Any args will be passed to the ReportBuilderBase.distill
**kwargs:
Any kwargs will be passed to the ReportBuilderBase.distill ..note:: outputNamePrefix will be overwritten/added
fseq.ReportBuilderPositionAverage
Returns self
undecidedValue[source]¶

fseq.reporting.reports module¶

Module for holding the various implemented reporting classes

class fseq.reporting.reports.HeatMap(name='heatmap.pdf', saveArgs=(), saveKwargs={})[source]¶

Bases: fseq.reporting.reports.ReportBase

Makes heatmaps from data

distill(data, name=None, outputRoot=None, outputNamePrefix=None, title=None, text=None, ylabel=None, xlabel=None, saveArgs=(), saveKwargs={}, vmin=None, vmax=None, aspect='auto', axisOff=True, cmap=<matplotlib.colors.LinearSegmentedColormap object at 0x2b9d0743ad90>, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Creates the actual heatmap.

data: numpy.ndarray
The data to be plotted
name: str, optional
If the default name of the HeatMap instance should be overwritten
outputRoot: str, optional
The directory in which to place the report
outputNamePrefix: str, optional
A prefix to prepend the name when saving the output.
title: str, optional
A title to be put over the heatmap
text: str, optional
An explanatory text to put under the plot
ylabel: str, optional
A label for the y-axis
xlabel: str, optional
A label for the x-axis
saveArgs: tuple or list, optional
A set of arguments to overwrite the instance’s default save args
saveKwargs: dict, optional
A set of keyword arguments to overwrite the instanc’s default
vmin: number, optional
To set a minimum color-scale number for the heatmap
vmax: number, optional
To set a maximum color-scale number for the heatmap
aspect: str, optional
The aspect ratio of the blocks/pixels in the heatmap, default is ‘auto’, which allows for rectangular pixels.
axisOff: bool, optional
If the axis of the plot should not be rendered (Default: True)
cmap: matplotlib.cmap, optional
A colormap to be used when plotting. (Default: Red – Blue)

class fseq.reporting.reports.ReportBase(name=None, saveArgs=(), saveKwargs={})[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for simple report creations.

Main purpose is to make a common interface for figure saving using matplotlib figures.

name saveArgs saveKwargs

distill(data, outputRoot=None, outputNamePrefix=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Placeholder distill interface not to be used.

NotImplementedError
Always raises this exception
name[source]¶
saveArgs[source]¶
saveFig(fig, outputRoot, outputNamePrefix, name=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Saves a figure and creates directories if needed.

fig: matplotlib.figure
The figure to be saved
outputRoot: str
The root directory for reports
outputNamePrefix: str
If the name of the file should be prepended by some string. Normally added by the Report Builder
name: str, optional
A specific name for this figure-file. If none supplied the default name for the report will be used, if no such has been set ValueError is raised.
*args:
Any arguments to be sent to matplotlib.Figure.save. If none added the ReportBase.saveArgs will be used.
**kwargs:
Any keyword arguments to be sent to matplotlib.Figure.save. If notn addd the ReportBase.saveKwargs will be used.
ReportBase
Returns self
ValueError
If no name has been given.
saveKwargs[source]¶
